protips.protip: You can buy and sell items and materials for Coin at your General Store.
You have opened a store that sells items which must first be unlocked by making a purchase from the Games for Windows - LIVE Marketplace.
Empire Point stores sell items that can only be purchased with Empire Points.
PvP buildings support matchmaking.
From the stores sold at the Blueprint Store, you can gain access to a wide range of Crafting Recipes.
At the Empire Bazaar, you can purchase new content and features for the game.
Workshops produce materials, even when you are not online. With the Workshop open, you can produce and collect materials the Workshop has already created.
From the Quest Map, you can select your quest on the map or the list to the left of the map. To launch, click the Begin Quest button.

Whoa, look at all of this technology! This is where you spend the Technology Points you earn when leveling. Hover over each item to see its description and be sure to browse all three tabs (Military, Economy, and Utility) for all your technology needs.

From the Gear Hall, equip gear to improve the quality and look of your units and buildings. To equip a piece of gear, open your Inventory and right-click what you want to equip while the Gear Hall is open. Gear cannot be traded once it has been equipped.
When you reach a new Age, new technologies are added that you can purchase with Technology Points.

protip.name: TIP_UI_TechTree_Reset
protip.title: How to Reset Your Tech Points

protips.protip: If you want to reset your Technology Tree, click the Reset button. It begins costing Coin when you reach level 10.
Form a party to play quests co-operatively. Then use the Co-op button to launch the quest together.

Use the Arena to set up PvP games with friends. To do this, form a party with another player by clicking the party icon or by typing /invite followed by the player's name in the chat window. Then use the Arena to launch the match.
The Crafting Hall is where you can pick Crafting Schools for your Capital City.

Crafting Schools hold the Crafting Recipes you have learned. If you have enough of the required materials in your Inventory, select a Recipe and click Create to begin producing the item described in the Recipe.
The Advisor Hall allows you to choose which Advisors will influence your progress while on quests. Collect different Advisors to access the broadest range of choices.
Chests often contain Materials. These are used to construct city buildings and for Crafting. You can save them, trade them to another player, or sell them at the General Store in your Capital City.
Check your Inventory for your new Crafting Recipe. To make it available for use at your Crafting School, right-click the Recipe to learn it.
To visit other players’ Capital Cities, right-click a player's name in the chat window and select View Empire. The same options are available if you click a friend's icon in your Friends List.
Click the Quest Map button to view your current quests.
When you have completed a quest, you can continue exploring the map or end the quest by accessing the Quest Map and clicking the Return to Quest City button.
You have discovered treasure! With a unit selected, right-click the treasure to add it to your Inventory.
To find treasure, be sure to explore the entire map, including the parts that are hidden by the black fog.
Click the Quest Map button to view your current quests.
You have discovered treasure that is guarded. Defeat the Guardians and right-click the treasure to receive your reward.
When you have completed a quest, you can continue exploring the map or end the quest by accessing the Quest Map and clicking the Return to Quest City button.
If you are stuck or have trouble with an objective, you can always ask for help in chat.
To construct a building in your city, open your Inventory and right-click the building's Blueprint. The building becomes your cursor; click where you want to place it.
You have been rewarded with your first piece of gear. Open your Inventory and right-click the gear to access the Gear Hall.
Congratulations, you have reached Age II, the Bronze Age. You now have access to more advanced technologies.
To travel to a new region, select it on your Quest Map, and then click the Travel To City button.
To Age Up during a quest, select your Town Center, and then click the Age Up icon. If you do not meet the requirements, they display red.
To return to your Capital City, select it by name on your Quest Map, and then click the Travel To City button.
This quest begins at Age II, with many new units under your control. Unlock them for future quests from the Technology Tree in your Capital City.

You have accepted a quest that can be played cooperatively with another person. To do this, form a party. Click the party icon or type /invite followed by the player's name in the chat window. Then look for the Co-op button when you open your Quest Map.
You can give resources that you own to other players who are your allies. This is called a tribute. To access the Tribute screen, click a resource number at the top of the screen.

If you want to play cooperatively with another person, form a party. Click the party icon or type /invite followed by the player's name in the chat window. Then look for the Co-op button when you open your Quest Map.
Use the Spartan Arena to begin PvP matches. Select the mode you want to play and then click Find Match to be paired with another player.
New quests are available at your City Ambassador.
For this quest, you must defend your Town Center. You can still try to defeat the enemy, but it will be a challenge.
You have received an optional repeatable quest. These may be available all the time or at intervals.
Global quests have objectives that can be completed during other quests.
You just accepted an optional challenge quest. Each quest in a series is harder than the previous one. If you can't complete a quest, try again when you have more experience.
Remember, you aren't required to do every quest. If one is too tough, you can always try it again later.
Speak with Marcus Pollux, who has a gift for you.
Click the Quest Map button to view your current quests. From here you can also navigate to other game regions like Sparta (PvP) and Cyprus (Skirmish).

Empire Points are used to purchase many things within the world of Age of Empires Online. They can be earned in-game and purchased from the Empire Point Store. Click the Empire Point icon to view the store.
Due to significant changes with the Technology Tree, it has been reset and all earned Technology Points have been unspent. Select the Palace to re-spend your points.
After you capture a Storehouse, try researching the Persian technology, Aid Tent. It is availabe no matter what Civilization you are playing.

The Palace can only be built by the player who launched the quest. If you're here to help, move your hero next to your factories to recruit units. Units will not train if you already own too many of that unit. Use your units to defend the Palace and to sabotage the enemy!
You've received an Empire Point reward (or rewards) based your participation in the Alliance Wars. View the amounts on the Stats page of the Alliance Wars UI.

Consumables are powerful items that can be used, or "consumed," to give you enormous temporary bonuses. Different kinds of Consumables can be found in chests, crafted, or purchased with Empire Points.
Click the "Technology" button to review your currently unlocked technology and spend your remaining tech points.
Click the "Gear" button to review the equipped gear that you received with your Pro Civilization.

The Arena and the Spartan Arena allow you to PvP in very different ways. When you build the Arena in your capital you can fight against your friends in arranged matches. From the Spartan Arena you can click Find Match to be paired with another player.
Pythagoras has prepared your quest stats with the Antikythera mechanism.
Use the Minoan War Council to launch the Defense of Crete quests. Each time you launch you can try a different experience of your own choosing.
To play the Defense of Crete demo, speak to King Minos.
Use the Skirmish Hall to launch Skirmish matches. Each time you launch, you can play with up to three friends or computer allies against up to four computer enemies in an experience of your choosing.
The Fertile Crescent Booster features over thirty quests that are available in the region of Babylon, earning you XP, Coin, and gear.
The Northern Invasion Booster is a quest pack that begins in the Northern Hold. Travel there now to begin.
Chief Vemundr is a Hero unit that will be with you for most of the quests in the Northern Invasion Booster Pack. He is fast, tough, and does a lot of damage.
Chief Vemundr can now be upgraded. Select him to review your choices. Each upgrade costs Gold, but will dramatically improve your Hero.

To capture Victory Towers and Treasuries, clear nearby enemies and move your Hero in range. After a few seconds, the location will be yours. Victory Towers grant points that are required for you to win. Treasuries grant Gold.

To capture Victory Towers and Treasuries, clear nearby enemies and move your Hero in range. After a few seconds, the location will be yours. Victory Towers grant points that are required for you to win. Treasuries grant Gold.

To capture Victory Towers and Treasuries, clear nearby enemies and move your Hero in range. After a few seconds, the location will be yours. Victory Towers grant points that are required for you to win. Treasuries grant Gold.
You have unlocked a special Hero Ability. It can be used whenever you want, but has a long cooldown. Try and time when you use it for when enemies are nearby.
You have unlocked a special Hero Ability. It can be used whenever you want, but has a long cooldown. Try and time when you use it for when enemies are nearby.
You have unlocked a special Hero Ability. It can be used whenever you want, but has a long cooldown. Try and time when you use it for when enemies are nearby.
Use the Training Camp to make units for your army.
The Training Camp allows you to research upgrades that improve your units. Upgrades cost Gold, which is also needed to train units, so choose wisely.
Use the Training Camp to make units for your army and to research upgrades. Each of these choices costs Gold, so choose wisely.
In co-op, both players have a Hero unit that can capture Victory Towers and Treasuries.
For this quest, your Hero will respawn after a brief delay. Look for your Hero near your Training Camp.
New quests are available at your City Ambassador.
New quests are available at your City Ambassador.
Build Storehouses close to gatherable resources to increase your gathering rate.
To place waypoints that the units follow, hold the Shift key and issue the movement commands.
To select a unit, click it. To order the unit to move or attack, right-click a valid destination or an enemy unit.
Hold the left mouse button and drag a box around a group of units to select them. Right-click an enemy to order them to attack the target.
You have gathered enough Food to train your first Villager. Select your Town Center and click the Villager icon in the Build menu.
Villagers can gather resources that are used to train units and build structures. Click to select a Villager and right-click the resource you want to gather.
Congratulations, you now have access to the Technology Tree. To view what's available, click the Palace.
To build a structure, select a Villager, click the building's icon, and then click a location to place it. If the building turns red, it can't be built at that location.
To construct a building faster, order more than one Villager to build it.
Watch out for predators such as wolves and lions. They're a source of food, but they fight back when attacked.
Houses increase your population limit. Once a House is built, increase your total population by training more Villagers at your Town Center.
The Storehouse is used by Villagers to drop-off resources. Build them close to gatherable resources to increase your gathering rate.
Hey look, you have a Cow now. Villagers can butcher it for Food; however, it can be stolen by enemy units. Moo.
You've constructed a Barracks. To train new infantry units, select the building, and then click the unit's icon in the Build menu.
Building Houses increases your population limit.
The Merchant Transport allows you to carry land units across the water. To load, select land units you want to transport, and then right-click the Transport.
You have units loaded on a Transport. To unload them, select the unit, click the eject button, and then click where you want to unload the transported units.
Some special units switch to your side when you move your own units to their position. After a few seconds, you control the units.
To repair a building, select a Villager, click the Repair button, and then select the building you want to repair. Repairing costs resources.
A Farm generates an infinite amount of Food as long as it is being worked by a Villager. However, it can be attacked and destroyed.
Congratulations, you have leveled up. Each time you level up, you earn Technology Points that can be used to make your civilization more powerful.
To build a Dock, select a Villager, click the Docks icon, and then place it by clicking a location near the shore.
You've constructed Docks. To build Fishing Boats, select the Docks and click the Fishing Boat icon in the Build menu.
Fishing Boats gather Food from fishing locations. They can also repair naval units and buildings.
To build a Farm, select a Villager, click the Farms icon, and then place it by clicking a location.
To repair a building, select a Villager, click the Repair button, and then select the building you want to repair. Repairing costs resources.
Rams are powerful siege weapons that can quickly destroy buildings. However, they are very vulnerable to taking damage from enemy units, so be sure to defend them.
Congratulations. You can now use Villagers and the Town Center when on quests. These form the backbone of your economy.
You can now build Houses on quests. Houses allow you to increase the maximum size of your army.
From now on, a single Scout is at your service at the start of most quests. Your Scout is fast and has a broad line of sight. Use your Scout to quickly locate resources and enemies.
You can now build Barracks and train Spearmen when you are on quests.
Cultivate the land with your new Farms. Unlike other food sources, Farms never run out of food.
Docks allow you to build naval units, starting with Fishing Boats.
Use Agamemnon's Triremes to add more troops to your invasion force.
You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Hetairoi. To train this unit yourself, acquire Commander Jason for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.
You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Phalanx. To train this unit yourself, acquire Commander Herculos for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.
You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Somatophylax. To train this unit yourself, acquire Commander Matius for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.
There are new quests available for you in your Capital City! Speak with the Helice Merchant and the Port Master to learn about their quests. And speak with Marcus Pollux, who has a gift for you.
The Helice Merchant in your Capital City has new quests for you.
The Village Scout in your Capital City has new quests for you.
The Port Master in your Capital City has new quests for you.
New quests are available for you in your Capital City.
New quests are available for you in Mycenae.

protip.name: TIP_C01_NewQuests_TroyBeachCamp
protip.title: New Quests at Troy Beach Camp!

protips.protip: New quests are available for you in Troy Beach Camp.
New quests are available for you in Troy.
New quests are available for you in Argos.
You have access to the Technology Tree and several pre-selected technologies. To view your currently unlocked technology, click the Palace.
Build Storehouses close to gatherable resources to increase your gathering rate.
To place waypoints that the units follow, hold the Shift key and issue the movement commands.
To select a unit, click it. To order the unit to move or attack, right-click a valid destination or an enemy unit.
Hold the left mouse button and drag a box around a group of units to select them. Right-click an enemy to order them to attack the target.
You have gathered enough Food to train your first Villager. Select your Town Center and click the Villager icon in the Build menu.
Villagers can gather resources that are used to train units and build structures. Click to select a Villager, and then right-click the resource you want to gather.
Congratulations, you now have access to the Technology Tree. To view what's available, click the Palace.
To build a structure, select a Villager, click the building's icon, and then place it by clicking a location. If the building turns red, it can't be built at that location.
To construct a building faster, order more than one Villager to build it.
Watch out for predators such as wolves and lions. They're a source of food, but they fight back when attacked.
Houses increase your population limit. Once a House is built, increase your total population by training more Villagers at your Town Center.
The Storehouse is used by Villagers to drop-off resources. Build them close to gatherable resources to increase your gathering rate.
Hey look, you have a Goat now. Villagers can butcher it for Food; however, it can be stolen by enemy units. Bah.
You've constructed a Barracks. To train new infantry units, select the building, and then click the unit's icon in the Build menu.
Building Houses increases your population limit.
To Age Up during a quest, select a Villager, and then build a Temple of Ra.
The Merchant Transport allows you to carry land units across the water. To load, select land units you want to transport, and then right-click the Transport.
You have units loaded on a Transport. To unload them, select the unit, click the eject button, and then click where you want to unload the transported units.
Some special units switch to your side when you move your own units to their position. After a few seconds, you control the units.
To repair a building, select a Villager, click the Repair button, and then select the building you want to repair. Repairing costs resources.
A Farm generates an infinite amount of Food as long as it is being worked by a Villager. However, it can be attacked and destroyed.
Congratulations, you have leveled up. Each time you level up, you earn Technology Points that can be used to make your civilization more powerful.
To build a Dock, select a Villager, click the Docks icon, and then place it by clicking a location near the shore.
You've constructed Docks. To build Fishing Boats, select the Docks, and then click the Fishing Boat icon in the Build menu.
Fishing Boats gather Food from fishing locations. They can also repair naval units and buildings.
To build a Farm, select a Villager, click the Farms icon, and then place it by clicking a location.
To repair a building, select a Villager, click the Repair button, and then select the building you want to repair. Repairing costs resources.
Siege Towers are powerful siege weapons that can quickly destroy buildings. However, they are very vulnerable to taking damage from enemy units, so be sure to defend them.
Congratulations, you have received new technology. You can now use Villagers and the Town Center when on quests. These form the backbone of your economy.
You can now build Houses on quests. Houses allow you to increase the maximum size of your army.
From now on, a single Scout is at your service at the start of most quests. Your Scout is fast and has a broad line of sight. Use your Scout to quickly locate resources and enemies.
You can now build Barracks and train Spearmen when you are on quests.
Cultivate the land with your new Farms. Unlike other food sources, Farms never run out of food.
Docks allow you to build naval units, starting with Fishing Boats.
Assign the Priestess of Ra to buildings to increase training rates, construction rates, and the number of resources dropped off.
Building Temples unlocks new units and technologies for Egypt. The Temple of Ra unlocks the first group of units and technologies.

You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Desert Swordsman. To train this unit yourself, acquire Nehkbet, Protector of the Lost, for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.
You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Desert Archer. To train this unit yourself, acquire Nynetjer, Lord of the Hunt, for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.
You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Desert Cavalry. To train this unit yourself, acquire the Roamer Djer for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.
You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Khopesh Swordsman. To train this unit yourself, acquire Blademaster Khaba for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.
There are new quests available for you in your Capital City! Speak with the Port Master to learn about his quests. And speak with Marcus Pollux, who has a gift for you.
King Narmer in your Capital City has new quests for you.
The Port Master in your Capital City has new quests for you.
New quests are available for you in Nubia.
New quests are available for you in Libya.
New quests are available for you in Argos.
You have access to the Technology Tree and several pre-selected technologies. To view your currently unlocked technology, click the Palace.
Build Storehouses close to gatherable resources to increase your gathering rate.
To place waypoints that the units follow, hold the Shift key and issue the movement commands.
To select a unit, click it. To order the unit to move or attack, right-click a valid destination or an enemy unit.
Hold the left mouse button and drag a box around a group of units to select them. Right-click an enemy to order them to attack the target.
You have gathered enough Food to train your first Villager. Select your Town Center and click the Villager icon in the Build menu.
Villagers can gather resources that are used to train units and build structures. Click to select a Villager and right-click the resource you want to gather.
Congratulations, you now have access to the Technology Tree. To view what's available, click the Palace.
To build a structure, select a Villager, click the building's icon, and then place it by clicking a location. If the building turns red, it can't be built at that location.
To construct a building faster, order more than one Villager to build it.
Watch out for predators such as wolves and lions. They're a source of food, but they fight back when attacked.
Houses increase your population limit. To increase your total population once a House is built, train more Villagers at your Town Center.
Villagers drop off resources at Storehouses. Build Storehouses close to gatherable resources to increase your gathering rate.
Hey look, you have a Sheep now. Villagers can butcher it for Food; however, it can be stolen by enemy units. Bah.
You've constructed a Barracks. To train new infantry units, select the building, and then click the unit's icon in the Build menu.
To increase your population limit, build more houses.
The Merchant Transport allows you to carry land units across the water. To load, select land units you want to transport, and then right-click the Transport.
You have units loaded on a transport. To unload them, select the unit, click Eject, and then click where you want to unload the transported units.
Some special units switch to your side when you move your own units to their position. After a few seconds, you control the units.
To repair a building, select a Villager, click Repair, and then select the building you want to repair. Repairing costs resources.
A Farm generates an infinite amount of Food as long as it is being worked by a Villager. However, it can be attacked and destroyed.
Congratulations, you have leveled up. Each time you level up, you earn Technology Points that can be used to make your civilization more powerful.
To build a Dock, select a Villager, click the Docks icon, and then place it by clicking a location near the shore.
You've constructed Docks. To build Fishing Boats, select the Docks and click the Fishing Boat icon in the Build menu.
Fishing Boats gather Food from fishing locations. They can also repair naval units and buildings.
To build a Farm, select a Villager, click the Farms icon, and then place it by clicking a location.
To repair a building, select a Villager, click Repair, and then select the building you want to repair. Repairing costs resources.
Rams are powerful siege weapons that can quickly destroy buildings. However, they are very vulnerable to taking damage from enemy units, so be sure to defend them.
To Age Up during a quest, select your Town Center, and then click the Age Up icon. You need 3 Houses before you can reach Age II.
The Market allows you to sell resources for Gold, buy resources using Gold, and train Caravans. The rates for buying and selling become worse as you use them.
You have built a Caravan. Click on a Town Center or Market to create a trade route. Caravans generate Gold when they complete their trade route.
Druids heal friendly units in a small area and empower them with bonus damage. They are also capable fighters.
The Alps are incredibly cold! Auggie takes damage constantly while he is traveling. Reach Druids to heal.
Remember, the Alps are still cold. Auggie and his friends will constantly take damage. Reach Druids to heal.

Take Brennos to the Barracks, Stables, or Archery Range to recruit units. The longer he stays at the building, the more units he recruits, but there is a cap per unit type. Recruit the best units to counter the enemy!
Auggie the Augur and his Augur allies can convert units to your side. Click on an enemy unit to convert it. Conversion takes time to complete.
Spearmen, unlike most military units, do not require Gold.
For this quest, the Co-op partner controls the Greek town of Lattes and has full access to the Greek civilization. Work together to save the town!
You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Headhunter. To train this unit yourself, you need to acquire Headhunter Etain for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.

You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Gaesatae. To train this unit yourself, you need to acquire Poison Crafter Orestorius for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.
You have a special Advisor unit at your command, the Longbowman. To train this unit yourself, you need to acquire Grand Master Deverell for your Advisor Hall. Advisors require a premium civilization.
Congratulations, you have received new technology. You can now use Villagers and the Town Center when on quests. These form the backbone of your economy.
You can now build Houses on quests. Houses allow you to increase the maximum size of your army.
From now on, a single Scout is at your service at the start of most quests. Your Scout is fast and has a broad line of sight. Use your Scout to quickly locate resources and enemies.
You can now build Barracks and train Spearmen when you are on quests.
Cultivate the land with your new Farms. Unlike other food sources, Farms never run out of food.
Docks allow you to build naval units, starting with Fishing Boats.
You can now build Sacred Groves and train Druids when you are on quests.
You have access to the Technology Tree and several pre-selected technologies. To view your currently unlocked technology, click the Palace.
OBSOLETE - SHOULD NOT DISPLAY

You have at your command a selection of the armies of the mighty Persian Empire. Train unique units like the Sparabara at the Barracks, the Takabara at the Archery Range, the Cataphract at the Stables, and the Immortal at the Immortal Camp.
The Immortal is a versatile unit that can switch between melee combat and ranged. Move close to engage enemies with melee; stay back to engage them with ranged.
Use your Villagers to build a War Academy and try out the Magus, a support unit capable of converting enemy units and healing friendly units while out of combat.
War Wagons are built from the Persian Siege Workshop. They excel against mobile units, but are not strong against structures.
Upgrade your Storehouses with the unique Persian Aid Tent technology and heal nearby ally units.
Toggle Techs like Rigorous Training and Paid Labor can be learned, enabled, and disabled at the War Academy. Enable them to apply bonuses at a cost; disable them when they are no longer needed.
Visit the Palace to review your currently unlocked technology and spend your remaining tech points.
Select your Gear Hall to review the equipped gear that you received with your Pro Persia Civilization.
Speak to Darius for unique Persian quests and access to Argos. Talk to the City Ambassador to receive the quest to visit the Sparta PvP region.
Build Storehouses close to gatherable resources to increase your gathering rate.
To place waypoints that the units follow, hold the Shift key and issue the movement commands.
To select a unit, click it. To order the unit to move or attack, right-click a valid destination or an enemy unit.
Hold the left mouse button and drag a box around a group of units to select them. Right-click an enemy to order them to attack the target.
You have gathered enough Food to train your first Villager. Select your Town Center and click the Villager icon in the Build menu.
Villagers can gather resources that are used to train units and build structures. Click to select a Villager and right-click the resource you want to gather.

Watch out for predators such as wolves and lions. They're a source of food, but they fight back when attacked.
Houses increase your population limit. To increase your total population once a House is built, train more Villagers at your Town Center.
The Storehouse is used by Villagers to drop-off resources. Build them close to gatherable resources to increase your gathering rate.
Hey look, you have a Cow now. Villagers can butcher it for Food; however, it can be stolen by enemy units. Moo.
You've constructed a Barracks. To train new infantry units, select the building and click the unit's icon in the Build menu.
Build Houses to increase your population limit.
The Merchant Transport allows you to carry land units across the water. To load, select land units you want to transport, and then right-click the Transport.
You have units loaded on a transport. To unload them, select the unit, click the eject button, and then click where you want to unload the transported units.
Some special units switch to your side when you move your own units to their position. After a few seconds, you control the units.
To repair a building, select a Villager, click the Repair button, and then select the building you want to repair. Repairing costs resources.
A Farm generates an infinite amount of Food as long as it is being worked by a Villager. However, it can be attacked and destroyed.
Congratulations, you have leveled up. Each time you level up, you earn Technology Points that can be used to make your civilization more powerful.
To build a Dock, select a Villager, click the Docks icon, and then place it by clicking a location near the shore.
You've constructed Docks. To build Fishing Boats, select the Docks and click the Fishing Boat icon in the Build menu.
Fishing Boats gather Food from fishing locations. They can also repair naval units and buildings.
To build a Farm, select a Villager, click the Farms icon, and then place it by clicking a location.
To repair a building, select a Villager, click the Repair button, and then select the building you want to repair. Repairing costs resources.
Rams are powerful siege weapons that can quickly destroy buildings. However, they are very vulnerable to taking damage from enemy units, so be sure to defend them.
Congratulations, you have received new technology. You can now use Villagers and the Town Center when on quests. These form the backbone of your economy.
You can now build Houses on quests. Houses allow you to increase the maximum size of your army.
From now on, a single Scout is at your service at the start of most quests. Your Scout is fast and has a broad line of sight. Use your Scout to quickly locate resources and enemies.
You can now build Barracks and train Spearmen when you are on quests.
Cultivate the land with your new Farms. Unlike other food sources, Farms never run out of food.
Docks allow you to build naval units, starting with Fishing Boats.
OBSOLETE - SHOULD NOT DISPLAY

Awaiting your command are the armies of the mighty Babylonian Empire. Train unique units like the Shield Bearer at the Barracks and the Lancer at the Stables, and construct buildings like the Babylonian Gardens to increase research rates and resource income.
Visit the Palace to review your currently unlocked technology and spend your remaining Tech Points.
Select your Gear Hall to review the equipped gear you received with your Pro Babylon Civilization.
Speak to King Nebuchadnezzar for unique Babylonian quests and access to Argos. Talk to the City Ambassador to receive the quest to visit the Sparta PvP region.
To Age Up during a quest, select a Villager, and then build a Ziggurat to advance to Age 2. The Ziggurat is also where you go to Age Up to Age 3 and Age 4.
The Babylonian Gardens are unique buildings that can speed up Research and automatically generate Food with the Cultivation upgrade found at the Ziggurat.
The Lancer can be upgraded to deliver a powerful charge attack on enemies with a burst of incredible speed!

Babylonians use Oxcarts as drop off locations for gathered resources gathering instead of Storehouses. Move your mobile "storehouse" to stay efficient, or protect your resources from enemies. Oxcarts can also traverse shallow water.
Shield Bearers are Infantry that are resistant to Ranged units. Groups of Shield Bearers can protect your own Ranged units by soaking up damage.

In Babylon, Siege Towers can destroy buildings and garrison units, effectively turning a fortification into a transport. When units are garrisoned in a Siege Tower, they can fire a barrage of arrows at attackers. (ALT + Right Click To Garrison)
Build Ziggurats to advance your Babylonian civilization through the Ages. This building also trains Priests and provides techs that globally buff your units.
OBSOLETE - SHOULD NOT DISPLAY

The Norse have landed, and await your command. Build factories with your Infantry units as well as your Villagers. Train units like the Berserker at the Barracks, the Bowman at the Archery Range, and the Raider at the Stables.
Click the "Technology" button to review your currently unlocked technology and spend your remaining tech points.
Click the "Gear" button to review the equipped gear that you received with your Pro Civilization.
Speak to King Theode for unique Norse quests and access to Argos. Talk to the City Ambassador to receive the quest to visit the Sparta PvP region.
Longships are the primary Age 2 fighting ship for the Norse, and they can also be used as transports.
The Norse start with two unique Scout units. One can build Outposts, while the other can build Barracks.
The Seer converts units and can create a flying Raven unit that can be used to get line-of-sight on your enemy.
War Dogs are cheap, fast-moving units that can snare enemies and be used to harass Cavalry. They can be trained at Outposts.
The Great Hall trains the Seer, Bard, and the Chief.
Norse Infantry units can build factories and defensive buildings.
The Norse Longhouse increases the maximum population by 10 units, and can also be used to garrison Villagers.
